data.title: Nice place!
data.text: We stopped at Ellie's on the way to Connecticut from Boston to grab some breakfast. This café is in a nice part of the city, and it is beautifully decorated. Very nice atmosphere. Good coffee, tasty baked goods, and we were in and out quickly.

data.title: Very good bakery
data.text: We had the croissant and it was amazing. A real an authentic croissant made from scratch. They have a great kitchen. Small place, and very crowded in the morning, but perfect place to just crab and go.

data.title: Must eat here
data.text: Ellis bakery saved me from starvation. I was staying in the Marriott on Exchange Street on a work trip and working long hours and found Ellies from trip advisor reviews and ate there every morning for 4 days. Food superb and the best I had in providence

data.title: Not my thing...
data.text: This bakery was close to my hotel and had good reviews on trip advisor, so I figured I would give it a try.  I got a ham croissant, and was not impressed at all.  It was served unheated, and did not have much flavor at all.  I noticed that everyone else seemed to be ordering avocado toast, so I figured I had just ordered the wrong thing.  The next morning, I gave it another try and went for the avocado toast this time.  The avocado spread was REALLY heavy on the lime.  So much so that I really could only taste the lime.  I consider myself to be an adventurous eater, and will even eat lots of non-traditional things for breakfast, but lime spread toast was a bit much for me in the morning.  After the second try, I decided I would have to find somewhere else to eat in the area while visiting Providence.  This place was definitely not my cup of tea, but others seemed to really like it.  I suppose it one you'd have to try for yourself.

data.title: A charming place for lunch downtown
data.text: The prices are low and the fare varied.  We had a grilled cheese sandwich that was particularly tasty.  The breads and pastries look fresh, as opposed to the nearby Starbuck’s. For lunch, there were two soups offered as well as an assortment of salads and sandwiches.  There is free wi fi, and the staff is friendly.  However, the space is cramped, so unless you’re lucky, takeout is your best bet.

data.title: Go past Dunkin' Donuts!
data.text: This is right near Dunkin' Donuts and it has home-made. The muffins are good, the pastries are, as we say in Rhode Island, "Way bettah". The coffee makes Dunkin' coffee taste like hot water.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Both the pastries and coffee were of excellent quality.  It is very small and the line did not move very quickly but in my opinion it was worth the wait.  Check it out!

data.title: Our favorite find in Providence
data.text: We loved this little cafe so much that we visited it twice during our 3 day stay in Providence. The food and coffee are delicious. The atmosphere is relaxed and has so much character. The staff are friendly and helpful. We loved everything about it! Our only wish is that we didn't have to travel so far to Providence enjoy it!

data.title: Friendly staff and great eats
data.text:
We stopped by Ellie's a couple of times during a weekend stay in Providence. It's a bit on the small side and usually always pretty busy (which is a testimony to its quality).

For a late morning rest while on a walking tour, an Ellie's Pork-belly and blue-cheese sandwich and coffee, sitting out at a table on the sidewalk and enjoying the day was exactly what we needed.

I really appreciated the friendliness of the staff!

data.title: Amazing food with friendly staff!
data.text: I went to Providence with my family back in August. We stayed right around the corner right from Ellie's. Our hotel front desk recommended Ellie's Bakery for breakfast so we decided to head there the first morning and boy were we happy. We ended up going back all three mornings that we were in Providence. The first morning I had the Avocado Toast. It was perfectly toasted bread with the most delicious avocado spread on it. My family all had breakfast sandwiches, scones, muffins and baguettes. We of course could not leave without their macaroons and some additional cookies for snacking. Highly recommend to anyone traveling through Providence!

data.title: Cute little bakery
data.text: Very friendly service with tasty croissants and breakfast sandwiches. Would recommend the classic sandwich with avocado!

data.title: Great bakery!
data.text:
I love this place and send guests here for breakfast all the time!  They have a great egg sandwich on an English muffin that they make in-house with a tomato jam!  The only thing is I'm pretty sure the eggs are microwaved.  Their specials are good, some great sandwiches (like the turkey!!!).  However, most of them are pre-made so allergy-wise it's not the best.  

The main reason to go of course is their Macaroons!  Absolutely divine.  My favorite is the Lemon Lavender

data.title: Good bakery
data.text: We stopped here on our last day for breakfast.  Very good bakery, very small inside, limited seating  We had breakfast sandwiches and they were awesome.  They also have a variety of other baked goods and very unique cookies.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Cozy, European scale space - not super comfortable seating except for tables out front, interior means stools and narrow counter surfaces. We went for breakfast and shared the avocado toast and the Croque Madame. The CM was wonderful, the avocado was only OK. Great coffee. A Mimosa would've been nice, but no liquor license - ah, well. The baked treats looked fantastic. We split a canele which was perfect.

data.title: Great Pastries and Breakfast Sandwiches
data.text: Whenever we go on trips, my sisters and I look for awesome bakeries or gourmet donut shops for breakfast. Ellie's is one of the best I've been to. It was a difficult decision to make but I ended up with a breakfast bun that had fresh berries on top and an egg sandwich on a flaky, delicious croissant. I also took some macaroons to go and they were just amazing. The peach were definitely my favorite from a box of strong contenders. Definitely stop by here if you're in the area.

data.title: Do it.
data.text: Ellie's was amazing. Lovely pastry selection, tried 3 and they were all great! Breakfast sandwiches and coffee drinks exceeded expectations. Cozy place, warm, friendly staff. Cakes looked awesome as well!

data.title: Rise Up. Shine On.
data.text: Love Ellie's!! The coffee and breakfast sandwiches are delicious. It's really hard to say no to their croissants too!! Perfect spot for an early morning bite. I like to beat the lines!

data.title: Fun spot for a quick bite and people watching
data.text: We went in because it looked cute. After coffee and a croissant we stayed for a breakfast sandwich because it was a fun place to spend half an hour people watching before heading out. Pleasant staff. Delicious pastry. Great combinations on the breakfast sandwiches.

data.title: Loved it
data.text: Ate here a few times.  charming little place downtown with tasty coffee and good breakfast options - quiche, pastries, house-made strawberry hand-pie was excellent.  Chicken salad sandwich and salad nicoise were also excellent.

data.title: Cute bakery
data.text: We entered the bakery and immediately were impressed by how clean it was, the variety of pastries and coffees was great, they have an inside area to eat or an outdoor area and the staff were very friendly
